full_text:
I'm about halfway through charting the punts for Week 1 (NFL Game Pass is really slowing me down) but I figured I'd start the Punt Shiny app up in the mean time. This will be updated and expanded with more stats using what I've collected soon! #nflverse

https://t.co/X6s6zvegV3 https://t.co/JKA7xVfDYT

There was actual football over the weekend! 

Here's the offensive and defensive efficiency of each team, pending #MNF

No surprise at the top, but take a look at that top 5 on offense ðŸ‘€

((As always, data ðŸŒ freeðŸŒ  from #nflverse)) https://t.co/OczvrsYpXj
Since 2000, there have been six games in which only four players were targeted in a game (the fewest amount in any game since then), per @nflfastR. #nflverse https://t.co/BJsk6yXPgx
Since 2000, the most targets that a player has recorded in a half is Tony Gonzalez with 17 in the second half of Week 17 of the 2004 season. #nflverse https://t.co/Tt8RVX5ncK

Best performing #NFL teams through Week 1 as represented by expected points added (EPA) for/against. For those unaware of EPA and how its used to evaluate aspects of team and player performance, check out the below post by the @The33rdTeamFB. #nflverse

https://t.co/D2Xp2GgNj3 https://t.co/wMTNQTuEiD

Today I saw that @FiveThirtyEight has a higher elo value for Big Ben than for Russell Wilson (which surprised me), so I decided to look at the data and plot current QB values in elo points including the changes after week 1. Look at Aaron Rodgers' drop off... 
#nflverse https://t.co/QLQlZwnNH3
Happily holding it over the rest of the #nflverse squad that I'm beating them in @LeeSharpeNFL's predictions contest...primarily off of the Steelers winning, no less! https://t.co/LJQqp6xCXY

A more realistic use-case of the gtExtras::gt_plt_bullet() inside a {gt} table below. The core table is ~8 lines of code.

Several high-profile QBs struggled in Wk 1, 2021 (dropped > 32 %-points from 2020).

Data: @ESPNStatsInfo & #nflverse 

#rstats Code: https://t.co/1UQikNjFnx https://t.co/OlKMjwwdKu

Time to overreact to small sample sizes! Will be posting the defensive efficiency charts each week again this season. Although these values may not fully stabilize until ~wk7, they are still fun to look at. Bonus internet points to anyone who can find the Chargers logo
#nflverse https://t.co/UXk1rJMCDb
